thread.title: Ja Rule's comeback; 'Serial' TV show; comedian trolls HLN; 'Star Trek 3': AM Buzz
thread.title_full: Ja Rule's comeback; 'Serial' TV show; comedian trolls HLN; 'Star Trek 3': AM Buzz | syracuse.com

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: Ja Rule's comeback; 'Serial' TV show; comedian trolls HLN; 'Star Trek 3': AM Buzz
text:
After spending two years in a Central New York prison for gun possession, Ja Rule's comeback is in full swing. The 39-year-old rapper-actor is recording a double album, launching a reality TV show and planning on a tour and film project with his "Always on Time" collaborator, Ashanti. "There comes a time when we've all got to grow up. For me that was prison," Rule says. "I realized the things I had worked so hard for were slipping away." His new family series "Follow the Rules" debuts on MTV Oct. 26 at 10 p.m. but no word on a release date for his music. He does say, however, that the movie will be a cross between Barbra Streisand's "A Star Is Born" and Oliver Stone's "Natural Born Killers" so it'll be interesting to see how his comeback is received.
» Read more at Billboard .
The popular podcast "Serial" will now be a television show , according to multiple reports. Fox is developing a series, directed by Chris Miller and Phil Lord ("The LEGO Movie," upcoming "Star Wars" spinoff movie about Han Solo), that will follow the making of the "This American Life" radio podcast's second season, created by Sarah Koenig and Julie Snyder. The first season's investigation of the 1999 killing of He Min Lee raised questions about her boyfriend Adnan Syed's murder conviction. "Serial" season 2 is rumored to focus on the Bowe Berghdal case.
» Read more at the New York Daily News .
A comedian trolled HLN , appearing on the cable news channel to talk about Edward Snowden joining Twitter -- but instead talked about Edward Scissorhands. Jon Hendren, best known as @fart on Twitter, appeared on "The Daily Share" Wednesday but admits to Esquire he had no idea why they booked him. Nevertheless, he had fun with it, talking about Edward "the hero," who was "[cast out] in society, simply because he has scissors for hands... people didn't get scared until he started sculpting shrubs into dinosaur shapes and what not." The best part is, no one on the show realized he was talking about the Tim Burton/Johnny Depp character the whole time.
Set your phasers for stun: " Star Trek 3" plot details are being revealed in photos posted by TMZ. Word is the Enterprise will take on some heavy damage in a battle on an alien planet, but details are still being kept under wraps. Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Zoe Saldana, Karl Urban, Simon Pegg, Anton Yelchin and John Cho will return, with Idris Elba and director Justin Lin ("Fast and Furious") adding some excitement. "Star Trek Beyond," produced by J.J. Abrams, hits theaters July 22, 2016.
» Read more at TMZ .
And Tom Hanks' son Chet Haze entered rehab this summer. The 25-year-old rapper admitted last year that he's been struggling with cocaine and other drugs, but revealed on Instagram that he's "doing pretty damn good" now. "I just really had to take a look at myself and my life and the way s--- was going and all the crazy stupid s--- I was doing and just finally admit to myself that it wasn't working," he said.
» See photos and read more at the Daily Mail .
